SummaryEnglish: The evil demon lord "Satan Gundam" suddenly appeared in the world of swords and magic "Suda Doaka World". The brave "Knight Gundam" who stood up to defeat the Demon King. In the RPG-like world view that began with Bandai's vendor machine Carddass 20, SD Gundam has become a hero and a monster, and is active in all directions.
Aliases: Mobile Suit SD Gundam: SD Gundam Legend

1.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam Mark I
1.SummaryEnglish:
Released with Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack. Contains the following shorts:
Fierce Fighting Chapter: Will Gundam Rise Up?
Holiday Chapter: Menace of the Zeon Hotel? The Order to Destroy Gundam Pension!!
Kyūjitsu-hen: Zeon Hotel no Kyōi? Gundam Penshon Hakai Meirei!!)

The video release includes the two shorts from the theatrical release above, in addition to a new episode:
Decisive Battle Chapter: SD Olympic!! The Stadium Saturated with Laughs
Kessen-hen: SD Olympic!! Stadium Warai ni Somete

2.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam Mark II
2.SummaryEnglish:
Includes the following shorts:
The Rolling Colony Affair
Original Gundam Stray Scenes Collection
Ganzo Gundam Meibamen-shū) (omake)
Gundam Legend

3.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam's Counterattack: Musha Gundam Visits
3.SummaryEnglish:
Released with Patlabor: The Movie. First animated appearance of the SD Sengokuden sub-series, which is based on the Musha Gundam toy line. Includes the following shorts:
The Storm-Calling School Festival
SD Warring States Legend: Chapter A Bao A Qu

4.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam Mark III
4.SummaryEnglish:
Includes the following shorts:
Battle of the Mystery of the Universe
SD Sengokuden: Zumushitei no Ninja Gassen
SD Sengokuden: Ten no Maki
SD Sengokuden: Ji no Maki
SD Sengokuden: Shin no Maki
SD Sengokuden: Ri no Maki

5.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam Mark IV
5.SummaryEnglish:
Includes the following shorts:
SD Gundam SD Wacky Races. Based on the American cartoon, Wacky Races. Due to copyright issues, this short was never released on DVD.
Dream Maron Company: "A Space Odyssey"
Appendix Part One: The One Year War Mobile Suit Catalog

6.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam Mark V
6.SummaryEnglish:
Includes the following shorts:
Miracle of Courier Re-GZ
SD Sengokuden: Gundam Go-ninshū no Mononoke Taiji
SD Gundam Sōseiki: Pikirienta Pōresu

7.TitleEnglish: Mobile Suit SD Gundam The Movie: Musha Knight Command: SD Gundam Scramble
7.SummaryEnglish:
Released with Mobile Suit Gundam F91. Features the first ever team-up of Command Gundam, Knight Gundam, Musha Gundam, who work together with a young girl named Riplin to fight evil. Video release contains SD Gundam Scramble along with two new segments:
Dawn of Paparu: Episode 103 "Suginamu's Bride", Paparu no Akatsuki Dai 103-wa "Suginamu no Hanayome)
G-ARMS Course (live-action omake introducing the different members of the SD Command Chronicles team, G-ARMS)

8.SummaryEnglish:
A feature-length movie divided into multiple parts as follows:
SD Command Chronicles II: Gundam Force Super G-ARMS Final Formula VS Noumugather. A teamup between various teams from SD Command Chronicles: SD Command Chronicles II's "Crushers" and SD Command Chronicles III's "Super G-Arms" and the Super Knight Final Formula.
SD Gundam Gaiden: Seikihei Monogatari: Dai 1-shō. Adaptation of the Knight Gundam Cardass and manga story, Seikihei Monogatari.
SD Sengokuden: Tenka Taihei-hen

2.TitleEnglish: SD Gundam Legend II: Legendary Giant

3.TitleEnglish: SD Gundam Legend III: Algus Knights

4.TitleEnglish: SD Gundam Legend IV: The Knight of Flash
